multi package¶

Submodules¶

multi.getmedia3 module¶

Obtain the media n and d from stack.dat Add transverse anisotropy on July 1 2014

multi.getmedia3.findmdc(media)¶
multi.getmedia3.getd(tn_str, lam_str)¶
multi.getmedia3.getmedia(media)¶
multi.getmedia3.getn(ri_str)¶

multi.getneff3 module¶

Effective index calculation for bi-axial in z

multi.getneff3.getneff(ri, tn, n, lam, ia)¶

ri=refractive index, ia=incident angle

multi.getz03 module¶

Calculate ncos, y, z of each layer. Media info from getneff3.

multi.getz03.getncos(ri, pol, ia, rin)¶

Obtain index*cos(beam_angle) and return impedance of each layer.

Parameters:
  • ri (complex) – refractive index
  • pol (str) – Polarization
  • ia (float in deg) – incident angle
  • rin (complex) – refractive index of input material
Returns:

ncos, impedance (z) and admittance (y)

multi.tmrefl3 module¶

Calculate the reflection coeff using TMM theory

multi.tmrefl3.getr(ri, tn, n, lam, ia, pol)¶

Get reflection.

It takes the effective index (possibly anisotropic) from getneff3, such as:

rin,neff = getneff3.getneff(ri,tn,n,lam,ia) 
r,rr,fi,z=getr(ri,tn,n,lam,ia,pol)
Parameters:
  • ri – refractive index in complex
  • tn – thickness in m
  • n – layer number in int
  • lam – wavelength in m
  • ia – incident angle in deg
  • pol – polarization in str
multi.tmrefl3.getrefl(ri, tn, n, lam, ia, pol)¶
multi.tmrefl3.getreflc(ri, tn, n, lam, ia, pol)¶
multi.tmrefl3.gettran(ri, tn, n, lam, ia, pol)¶
multi.tmrefl3.getv(ri, tn, n, lam, ia, pol)¶

get the v or field value on boundary
